title: Versailles Township, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania
text:
The Township of Versailles was one of the seven original townships of <a href="Allegheny%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Allegheny County, Pennsylvania</a> created during the first meeting of the Allegheny County Court in 1788. The other townships were <a href="Pitt%20Township%2C%20Allegheny%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Pitt</a> (which included the village of <a href="Pittsburgh">Pittsburgh</a>), <a href="Plum%2C%20Pennsylvania">Plum</a>, <a href="St.%20Clair%20Township%2C%20Allegheny%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">St. Clair</a>, <a href="Moon%20Township%2C%20Allegheny%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Moon</a>, Mifflin, and <a href="Elizabeth%20Township%2C%20Allegheny%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Elizabeth</a>. Versailles was named for <a href="Versailles">Versailles</a>, <a href="France">France</a>, in honor of the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>' French allies during the <a href="American%20Revolution">American Revolution</a>.
Versailles Township originally comprised that portion of the county lying east of the <a href="Monongahela%20River">Monongahela River</a>, south of <a href="Turtle%20Creek%20%28Monongahela%20River%20tributary%29">Turtle Creek</a> and north of the <a href="Youghiogheny%20River">Youghiogheny River</a>. A corner of the township broke away in 1842 to form the borough of <a href="McKeesport%2C%20Pennsylvania">McKeesport</a>. The remainder split into <a href="North%20Versailles%20Township%2C%20Allegheny%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">North Versailles</a> and <a href="South%20Versailles%20Township%2C%20Allegheny%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">South Versailles</a> townships in 1869. Motivating this split was the growth of the communities of <a href="Port%20Perry%2C%20Pennsylvania">Port Perry</a> and <a href="Coulter%2C%20Pennsylvania">Coultersville</a> at opposite extremes of the territory. Further divisions gave rise to the boroughs of <a href="Versailles%2C%20Pennsylvania">Versailles</a>, <a href="East%20McKeesport%2C%20Pennsylvania">East McKeesport</a>, <a href="Wall%2C%20Pennsylvania">Wall</a>, <a href="White%20Oak%2C%20Pennsylvania">White Oak</a>, and portions of <a href="Wilmerding%2C%20Pennsylvania">Wilmerding</a> and <a href="Trafford%2C%20Pennsylvania">Trafford</a>.
